Articles.Content:
Here is my version of a delta V map for 1.05

[![7lRt6TN.png](http://i.imgur.com/7lRt6TN.png)](http://imgur.com/7lRt6TN)

In order to use this map you add up all of the numbers between you and your destination e.g. to get to Duna from low Kerbin orbit will take 950+ 110+ 370= 1430 m/s of Delta V

The map is only an approximation and you can make do with less Delta V but I would recommend having more than the chart suggests.

I did not do the calculations for that I used two different charts:

One chart was made back in 2013 by [@SkyRender](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/10651-skyrender/) and was used for most of the in orbit values.

The other chart was [@Kowgan](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/116874-kowgan/) who credited the following in his thread: [@JellyCubes](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/11002-jellycubes/) WAC,  CuriousMetaphor, [@swashlebucky](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/149389-swashlebucky/) and AlexMooon. This chart was used for the in atmosphere numbers. 

I hope you find this useful.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-03-10T18:17:29Z" title="03/10/2016 06:17  PM" data-short="8 yr">March 10, 2016</time> by mrmcp1**
  
update for 1.05
I have finally updated this chart for 1.05. It is now in colour!

Your dV map is very simplified; I would recommend not displaying moons because, those figures aren't exact. It's very visible for Jool sub-system. You don't need to circularize in low Duna orbit to go to Ike. You should display intercepts/capture and low orbit.

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/87463-105-swashs-delta-v-map-continued-22-nov-17th-opm-update/&do=embed"></iframe>

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Warzouz said:
> 
> 
> Your dV map is very simplified; I would recommend not displaying moons because, those figures aren't exact. It's very visible for Jool sub-system. You don't need to circularize in low Duna orbit to go to Ike. You should display intercepts/capture and low orbit.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> <iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/87463-105-swashs-delta-v-map-continued-22-nov-17th-opm-update/&do=embed"></iframe>
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Thanks or the feedback. If I was to do it again I would include those figures. I personally find it useful because I am terrible at getting gravity assists and aero capture so I am not too concerned about efficiency. At some point I may come back to it and include other features such as intercept, capture and low orbit.
>

[@mrmcp1](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/79657-mrmcp1/), even you don't use gravity assists (which I don't do either, except on rare occasions), you still don't circularize at low Jool orbit if you want do go to Tylo. You do a minimal capture burn (elliptic orbit) and get an encounter with the moon.

Capture figures is not abour gravity assists. If you do gravity assist you can even save more fuel.

> 
> 
> Just now, Warzouz said:
> 
> 
> [@mrmcp1](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/79657-mrmcp1/), even you don't use gravity assists (which I don't do either, except on rare occasions), you still don't circularize at low Jool orbit if you want do go to Tylo. You do a minimal capture burn (elliptic orbit) and get an encounter with the moon.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Capture figures is not abour gravity assists. If you do gravity assist you can even save more fuel.
> 

Thanks, I had not thought of it like that.

> 
> 
> On 3/24/2016 at 1:01 PM, Warzouz said:
> 
> 
> Capture figures is not abour gravity assists. If you do gravity assist you can even save more fuel.
> 

Adding on to this, going direct from one moon to another can save even more fuel, For instance, I can go from Mun to Ike and back for just a little over half the DV the maps suggest. But of course there's not an easy way to put that into a map...

Best,  

-Slashy
Wow... 8.000 dV to return from Eve? Back in ye olde days, it was close to 12.000... this means, a much smaller lander can be used. Awesome! Thanks a lot!

> 
> 
> 7 minutes ago, Frank\_G said:
> 
> 
> Wow... 8.000 dV to return from Eve? Back in ye olde days, it was close to 12.000... this means, a much smaller lander can be used. Awesome! Thanks a lot!
> 

I think it can be done for less than 7000m/s

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, GoSlash27 said:
> 
> 
> Adding on to this, going direct from one moon to another can save even more fuel, For instance, I can go from Mun to Ike and back for just a little over half the DV the maps suggest. But of course there's not an easy way to put that into a map...
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Best,  
> 
> -Slashy
> 

Thanks, I think the only way to make a map like that would be separate ones starting from each body. Out of interest was that an approximation from your experience or did you calculate it?

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Warzouz said:
> 
> 
> I think it can be done for less than 7000m/s
> 

There are some quite large DV margins built in so pilots who aren't very good (like me) should be able to make it.

> 
> Out of interest was that an approximation from your experience or did you calculate it?

Actually, I did both. Calculated it and then executed it to make sure I wasn't nuts.

Best,

-Slashy
